intro: Loeselia rzedowskii, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a striking plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, known for its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting hummingbirds and other pollinators due to their nectar-rich structure. Loeselia rzedowskii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
